newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares close up on Wolford, OMV gains.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares close up on Wolford, OMV gains.

text.p: Austrian shares closed higher on Tuesday, boosted by strong demand in luxury hosiery maker Wolford and oil and chemicals group OMV, and traders predicted further gains ahead of Friday's futures and options expiry.
The ATX index of 21 blue chips edged up 1.54 points or 0.14 percent to 1,126.12. Seven ATX shares rose, 13 fell and one remained unchanged.
Traders said the ATX was well-supported at 1,120 and saw it reaching its next target of 1,130 by the end of the year.
The session's top gainer was luxury hosiery maker Wolford, climbing 6.73 percent to 1,214 schillings.
Oil and chemicals group OMV climbed 1.89 percent to 213.5 schillings on turnover of over 110,000 on a technical rebound.
Bank Austria preferred shares led the decliners, falling 2.43 percent to 402 schillings.
Regional utility EVN, which went ex-dividend today, fell 17 schillings to 1,541, but traders said the loss was short-term.
The December ATX future gained 3.2 points to 1,122.7. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112257
